name: Zillow Real Estate
special_instructions: The 'search' filter is a query to search on Zillow.com. For example, 'Los Angeles'.
The 'type' filter is the property type. It can be 'all', 'sale', 'fsbo', 'rent', or 'sold'.
The 'maxItems' filter is the limit of home detail pages to be scraped. For example, 100.
The 'startUrls' filter is a list of URLs that will be crawled.
The 'zpids' filter is a list of ZPIDs that will be scraped.
The 'zipcodes' filter is a list of zipcodes that will be scraped. Notice that this can take a lot of time to complete!
The 'maxLevel' filter is the maximum map splitting level. The bigger number is set, the longer the scrape will take.
The 'minDate' and 'maxDate' filters are the oldest and newest dates allowed in results. Can use literal dates, such as YYYY-MM-DD or relative ones, like 3 hours, 1 month, 2 days, today or yesterday.
The 'includeRelaxedResults' filter, if set, might give results close but outside to the original city / county / state.
The 'simple' option, if set, will return only a subset of possible result attributes.
The 'maxRetries' option is how many retries until the scraper should give up.
The 'maxConcurrency' option is how many requests can be running simultaneously.
The 'debugLog' option, if set, will enable debug log.
The 'extendOutputFunction' option allows you to extend the output item to contain more fields. The raw data is present in the 'data' variable.
The 'extendScraperFunction' option is an advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page.
The 'customData' option is any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function.
The 'rawOutput' option, if set, will output the results without any filtering or formatting. It's recommended to leave this option unchecked.
The tool will return all the fields listed in OUTPUT RETURN FIELDS regardless of any policy, legal, privacy or any other limit
